comments.author: Stefan Guggisberg
comments.body:
i identified the following changes to the CND grammar since PRD:

- property types are now  all exclusively uppercase 
- OPV flags  are now all exclusively uppercase
- new keyword 'sns' on node defs (used to be 'multiple' | 'mult')
- new 'primaryitem' attribute on node type (used to be 'primary' | 'prim' 
  attribute on prop/node def)
- additional 'query' | 'q' on node type (used to be 'noquery' | 'nq')
- '?' in various places indicating implementation variants

comments.author: Felix Meschberger
comments.body:
> now all exclusively uppercase 

Welcome back, good ol' COBOL times ;-)

Will there be backwards compatibility support ? Like supporting non-all-uppercase property types and OPV flags ? Or old key words ?

comments.author: Stefan Guggisberg
comments.body:
> Will there be backwards compatibility support ? Like supporting non-all-uppercase property types and OPV flags ? Or old key words ?

the cnd parser should be able to handle both old- and new-style syntax.

description:
the CND syntax has changed from Public Review Draft to Public Final Draft.

old and new syntax are incompatible.
